member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action
member.summary: A CIM_Action class is an operation that is part of a process to either create a software element in its next state or to eliminate the software element in the current state.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Invoke
member.summary: The Invoke method of the CIM_Action class takes a particular action. The details of how the method performs the action is implementation-specific.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.ActionID
member.summary: Unique identifier assigned to a particular action for a software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Caption
member.summary: Short textual description of the object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Description
member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Direction
member.summary: Indicates whether a particular CIM_Action object is part of a sequence of actions to transition the current software element to its next state, such as "Install", or to remove the current software element, such as "Uninstall".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Name
member.summary: Identifies the software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.SoftwareElementID
member.summary: Identifier for the software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.SoftwareElementState
member.summary: State of a software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.TargetOperatingSystem
member.summary: Target operating system of the owning software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Action.Version
member.summary: Version of the operation. The version of the operation should be in one of the following forms: major.minor.revision

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActionSequence
member.summary: The CIM_ActionSequence association defines a series of operations that transition the software element (referenced by the CIM_SoftwareElementActions association) to its next state, or removes the software element from its current state. The next-state actions and uninstall actions associated with a particular software element must be a continuous sequence. Since CIM_ActionSequence is an association, the loops on the CIM_Action class, with roles for the "prior" action and "next" action, form a sequence. The need for a continuous sequence implies: Within the set of next-state or uninstall actions, there is only one action that does not have an instance of the CIM_ActionSequence association referencing it in the "next" role. This is the first action in the sequence. Within the set of next-state or uninstall actions, there is only one action that does not have an instance of the CIM_ActionSequence association referencing it in the "prior" role. This is the last action in the sequence. All other actions within the set of next-state and uninstall actions must participate in two instances of the CIM_ActionSequence association, one in a "prior" role and one in the "next" role.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActionSequence.Next
member.summary: Reference to the next action.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActionSequence.Prior
member.summary: Reference to the prior action.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection
member.summary: Defines a connection that is currently communicating, or is configured to communicate, between two service access points. It is used when the connection is not handled as a managed element itself (that is, with Status, statistics, and so on), but its existence is known. A service access point (SAP) that is connected typically operates at the same networking or application layer.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SAPSAPDependency
member.summary: The CIM_SAPSAPDependency class is an association between two service access points (SAPs), which indicates that the second SAP is required for the first SAP to connect with its service. For example, to print on a network printer, local printer access points must use underlying network-related SAPs, or protocol endpoints, to send the print request.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Dependency
member.summary: The CIM_Dependency class represents an association that establishes dependency relationships between objects.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Dependency.Antecedent
member.summary: Reference to the independent object in this association.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Dependency.Dependent
member.summary: Reference to the object that is dependent on the Antecedent property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SAPSAPDependency.Antecedent
member.summary: The required SAP.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SAPSAPDependency.Dependent
member.summary: The SAP is dependent on an underlying SAP.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection.Antecedent
member.summary: A SAP that is configured to communicate or is actively communicating with the dependent SAP. In a unidirectional connection, this is the transmitting SAP.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection.Dependent
member.summary: A second SAP that is configured to communicate or is actively communicating with the antecedent SAP. In a unidirectional connection, this is the receiving SAP.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection.TrafficType
member.summary: Note: The use of this element is deprecated because it is incorrectly placed on the association. Unicast, broadcast, or other traffic types are not a function of the connection between the referenced endpoints, but rather are a function of the addressing, protocol, and basic functionality of the endpoints. Deprecated description: The type of traffic that is carried over this connection.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection.OtherTrafficDescription
member.summary: Note: The use of this element is deprecated because it is incorrectly placed on the association. Unicast, broadcast, or other traffic types are not a function of the connection between the referenced endpoints, but rather are a function of the addressing, protocol, and basic functionality of the endpoints. Deprecated description: A string that describes the type of traffic that is being carried over this instance when its Type property is set, for example, to 1 (Other).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActiveConnection.IsUnidirectional
member.summary: TRUE indicates that this connection is unidirectional; FALSE indicates that this connection is bidirectional. When the connection is unidirectional, the "speaker" should be defined as the antecedent reference. In a bidirectional connection, the selection of which access point is the antecedent or dependent is immaterial.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActsAsSpare
member.summary: The CIM_ActsAsSpare association indicates which elements can be spares or replace other aggregated elements. A spare can operate in "hot-standby" mode as specified on an element-by-element basis.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActsAsSpare.Group
member.summary: Reference to the Group property that represents the CIM_SpareGroup class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActsAsSpare.HotStandby
member.summary: If TRUE, the spare is operating as a hot standby.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ActsAsSpare.Spare
member.summary: Reference to a managed system element acting as a spare and participating in the spare group.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AllocatedResource
member.summary: The CIM_AllocatedResource class represents an association between logical devices and system resources and indicates that the resource is assigned to the device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedMemory
member.summary: The CIM_AssociateMemory class associates installed or associated memory, such as cache memory with a logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedMemory.Antecedent
member.summary: Reference to the memory installed on, or associated with, a device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedMemory.Dependent
member.summary: Reference to the logical device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedProcessorMemory
member.summary: The CIM_AssociatedProcessorMemory class associates the processor and system memory, or a processor's cache.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedProcessorMemory.Antecedent
member.summary: Reference to the memory installed on or associated with a device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedProcessorMemory.BusSpeed
member.summary: Speed of the bus, in megahertz (MHz), between the processor and memory.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_AssociatedProcessorMemory.Dependent
member.summary: Reference to the processor that accesses the memory or uses the cache.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_BIOSElement
member.summary: The CIM_BIOSElement class represents the low-level software that is loaded into non-volatile storage and used to start and configure a computer system.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement
member.summary: The CIM_SoftwareElement class decomposes a CIM_SoftwareFeature object into a set of individually manageable or deployable parts for a particular platform. A software element's platform is uniquely identified by its underlying hardware architecture and operating system. As such, to understand the details of how the functionality of a particular software feature is provided on a particular platform, the CIM_SoftwareElement objects referenced by CIM_SoftwareFeatureSoftwareElements associations are organized in disjoint sets based on the TargetOperatingSystem property. A CIM_SoftwareElement object captures the management details of a part or component in one of four states characterized by the SoftwareElementState property.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalElement
member.summary: The CIM_LogicalElement class is the base class for all system components that represent abstract system components, such as profiles, processes, or system capabilities, in the form of logical devices.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement
member.summary: The CIM_ManagedSystemElement class is the base class for the system element hierarchy. Any distinguishable system component is a candidate for inclusion in this class. Examples include software components, such as files; devices, such as disk drives and controllers; and physical components, such as chips and cards.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement.Caption
member.summary: Short textual description of the object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement.Description
member.summary: Textual description of the object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement.InstallDate
member.summary: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, this property can be overridden to be a key property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ManagedSystemElement.Status
member.summary: String that indicates the current status of the object. Operational and non-operational status can be defined. Operational status can include "OK", "Degraded", and "Pred Fail". "Pred Fail" indicates that an element is functioning properly, but is predicting a failure (for example, a SMART-enabled hard disk drive). Non-operational status can include "Error", "Starting", "Stopping", and "Service". "Service" can apply during disk mirror-resilvering, reloading a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, but the managed element is neither "OK" nor in one of the other states.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.BuildNumber
member.summary: Internal identifier for the compilation of this software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.CodeSet
member.summary: Code set used by the software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.IdentificationCode
member.summary: Manufacturer's identifier for the software element, often a stock-keeping unit (SKU) or part number.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.LanguageEdition
member.summary: Language edition of the software element. The language codes defined in ISO 639 should be used. Where the software element represents multilingual or international versions of a product, the string "multilingual" should be used.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.OtherTargetOS
member.summary: Manufacturer and operating system type for a software element when the TargetOperatingSystem property has a value of 1 ("Other"). When the TargetOperatingSystem property has a value of 1, this property must have a non-null value. For all other TargetOperatingSystem values, this property is null.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.SerialNumber
member.summary: Serial number of the software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.SoftwareElementID
member.summary: Identifier for the software element. It is designed to be used in conjunction with other keys to create a unique representation of this CIM_SoftwareElement.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.SoftwareElementState
member.summary: State of a software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.TargetOperatingSystem
member.summary: Operating system environment. The value of this property does not ensure binary executability, more information is needed. The operating system version must be specified using the operating system version check. Also needed, is the architecture on which the operating system runs. The combination of these constructs allows the provider to clearly identify the level of operating system required for a particular software element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SoftwareElement.Version
member.summary: Version of the operation. The version of the operation should be in one of the following forms: major.minor.revision

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_BIOSElement.PrimaryBIOS
member.summary: If TRUE, this is the primary BIOS of the computer system.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CDROMDrive
member.summary: The CIM_CDROMDrive class represents a CD-ROM drive on the computer. Note The name of the drive does not correspond to the logical drive letter assigned to the device, which is the name of the logical storage device that is dependent on the drive.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice
member.summary: The CIM_MediaAccessDevice class represents the ability to access one or more media, and then use the media to store and retrieve data.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice
member.summary: The CIM_LogicalDevice class represents a hardware entity that may or may not be realized in physical hardware. Logical device characteristics that manage operation or configuration are contained in, or associated with, the CIM_LogicalDevice object. Printer operational properties, for example, are supported paper sizes or detected errors. Sensor device configuration properties, for example, are threshold settings. Various configurations can exist for a logical device and are contained in the CIM_Setting objects, which are associated with the logical device.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.Reset
member.summary: Requests a reset of the logical device. Not implemented by WMI.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.SetPowerState(System.UInt16,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Defines the desired power state for a logical device and when a device should be put into that state. Not implemented by WMI.
member.param: A ValueMap value that specifies the desired power state for this logical device.

Specifies when the power state should be set, either as a regular date-time value or as an interval value (where the interval begins when the method invocation is received). When the PowerState parameter is equal to 5 ("Power Cycle"), the Time parameter indicates when the device should power on again. Power-off is immediate.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.Availability
member.summary: Availability and status of the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.ConfigManagerErrorCode
member.summary: Win32 Configuration Manager error code.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.ConfigManagerUserConfig
member.summary: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.DeviceID
member.summary: Address or other identifying information to uniquely name the logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.ErrorCleared
member.summary: If TRUE, the error reported in the LastErrorCode property is now cleared.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.ErrorDescription
member.summary: Free-form string that supplies information about the error recorded in the LastErrorCode property and corrective actions to perform.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.LastErrorCode
member.summary: Last error code reported by the logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.PNPDeviceID
member.summary: Indicates the Win32 Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. Example: "*PNP030b"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.PowerManagementCapabilities
member.summary: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.PowerManagementSupported
member.summary: If TRUE, the device can be power managed, that is, put into a power-save state. If FALSE, the integer value 1 ("Not Supported") should be the only entry in the PowerManagementCapabilities array. This property does not indicate whether power management features are currently enabled, or if enabled, which features are supported. For more information, see the PowerManagementCapabilities array.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.StatusInfo
member.summary: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 ("Not Applicable") should be used.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.SystemCreationClassName
member.summary: Scoping system's creation class name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_LogicalDevice.SystemName
member.summary: Scoping system's name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.Capabilities
member.summary: Capabilities of the media access device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.CapabilityDescriptions
member.summary: Array of free-form strings that provides detailed explanations for access device features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note Each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array, located at the same index.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Free-form string that indicates the algorithm or tool used to compress the logical file. If the compression scheme is unknown or not described, use "Unknown". If the logical file is compressed, but the compression scheme is unknown or not described, use "Compressed". If the logical file is not compressed, use "Not Compressed".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.DefaultBlockSize
member.summary: Default block size, in bytes, for the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.ErrorMethodology
member.summary: Free-form string that describes the types of error detection and correction supported by the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.MaxBlockSize
member.summary: Maximum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.MaxMediaSize
member.summary: Maximum size, in kilobytes, of media supported by this device. Kilobytes are interpreted as the number of bytes multiplied by 1000 (not the number of bytes multiplied by 1024).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.MinBlockSize
member.summary: Minimum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.NeedsCleaning
member.summary: If TRUE, the media access device needs cleaning. Whether manual or automatic cleaning is possible is indicated in the Capabilities array property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MediaAccessDevice.NumberOfMediaSupported
member.summary: Maximum number of multiple individual media that can be supported or inserted.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Chip
member.summary: The CIM_Chip class represents the type of integrated circuit hardware, including ASICs, processors, memory chips, and so on.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalComponent
member.summary: The CIM_PhysicalComponent class represents a low-level or basic component within a package. A physical element that is not a link, connector, or package is a descendent (or member) of this class. For example, the UART chipset on an internal modem card would be a subclass (if additional properties or associations are defined) or an instance of CIM_PhysicalComponent.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement
member.summary: The CIM_PhysicalElement subclasses define any component of a system that has a distinct physical identity. Instances of this class can be defined in terms of labels that can be physically attached to the object. All processes, files, and logical devices are not considered to be physical elements. For example, it is not possible to attach a label to a modem; it is only possible to attach a label to the card that implements the modem. The same card could also implement a LAN adapter. Tangible managed system elements (usually hardware items) have a physical manifestation. A managed system element is not necessarily a discrete component. For example, it is possible for a single card (a type of physical element) to host more than one logical device. The card would be represented by a single physical element associated with multiple logical devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.Model
member.summary: Name by which the physical element is generally known.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.OtherIdentifyingInfo
member.summary: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar-code data that is associated with an element, which also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar-code data is available, and is unique and able to be used as an element key, this property would be null and the bar-code data would be used as the class key in the Tag property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.PartNumber
member.summary: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.PoweredOn
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. Otherwise, it is currently off.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.SerialNumber
member.summary: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.SKU
member.summary: Stock-keeping unit number for this physical element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.Tag
member.summary: Arbitrary string that uniquely identifies the physical element and serves as the element's key. This property can contain information, such as asset tag or serial number data. The key for CIM_PhysicalElement is placed very high in the object hierarchy to independently identify the hardware or entity, regardless of physical placement in (or on) cabinets, adapters, and so on. For example, a removable component that can be hot-swapped can be taken from its containing (scoping) package and be temporarily unused. The object still continues to exist and can even be inserted into a different scoping container. The key for a physical element is an arbitrary string that is defined independently of placement or location-oriented hierarchy.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalElement.Version
member.summary: String that indicates the version of the physical element.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalComponent.HotSwappable
member.summary: If TRUE, the package can be hot-swapped. A physical package can be hot-swapped if the element can be replaced by a physically different (but equivalent) one while the containing package is turned on. For example, a fan component may be designed to be hot-swapped. All components that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalComponent.Removable
member.summary: If TRUE, this element is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging. A package is considered removable even if the power must be off to perform the removal. If the power can be on and the package removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an upgradeable processor chip is removable.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalComponent.Replaceable
member.summary: If TRUE, it is possible to replace the element with a physically different one. For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. All removable components are inherently replaceable.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Chip.FormFactor
member.summary: Implementation form factor for the chip.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ControlledBy
member.summary: The CIM_ControlledBy relationship indicates which devices are commanded by, or accessed through, the controller logical device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DeviceConnection
member.summary: The CIM_DeviceConnection association class represents two or more connected devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DeviceConnection.NegotiatedDataWidth
member.summary: When several bus or connection-data widths are possible, this property defines the one in use between the devices. Data width is specified in bits. If data width is not negotiated, or if this information is not available or important to device management, the property should be set to 0 (zero).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DeviceConnection.NegotiatedSpeed
member.summary: When several bus or connection speeds are possible, this property defines the one being used between the devices. Speed is specified in bits-per-second. If connection or bus speeds are not negotiated, or if this information is not available or important to device management, the property should be set to 0 (zero).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ControlledBy.AccessState
member.summary: Indicates whether the controller is actively commanding or accessing the device. This information is necessary when a logical device can be commanded by, or accessed through, multiple controllers.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ControlledBy.NumberOfHardResets
member.summary: Number of hard resets issued by the controller. A hard reset returns the device to its initialization or boot-up state. All internal device state information and data are lost.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ControlledBy.NumberOfSoftResets
member.summary: Number of soft resets issued by the controller. A soft reset does not completely clear current device state and data. Exact semantics are dependent on the device and on the protocols and mechanisms used to communicate to it.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Controller
member.summary: The CIM_Controller class is a parent class for grouping miscellaneous control-related devices. Examples of controllers are SCSI controllers, USB controllers, and serial controllers. The CIM_Controller class is an abstraction for devices with a single protocol stack, which exist primarily for communication to, and control or reset of, downstream (CIM_ControlledBy) devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Controller.MaxNumberControlled
member.summary: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supported by this controller. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown or unlimited.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Controller.ProtocolSupported
member.summary: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Controller.TimeOfLastReset
member.summary: Date and time the controller was last reset (powered down or reinitialized).

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CoolingDevice
member.summary: The CIM_CoolingDevice class represents the capabilities and management of cooling devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CoolingDevice.ActiveCooling
member.summary: If TRUE, the cooling device provides active (as opposed to passive) cooling.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CopyFileAction
member.summary: The CIM_CopyFileAction class represents moving or copying files from a computer system to a new location. Location information for copying is specified by using either the CIM_ToDirectorySpecification and CIM_FromDirectorySpecification associations, or the CIM_ToDirectoryAction and CIM_FromDirectoryAction associations. The first set is used when the source or target are to exist before any actions are taken. The second set is used when the source or target are created as a part of a previous action. In the latter case, the action to create the directory must occur prior to the CIM_CopyFileAction object.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_FileAction
member.summary: The CIM_FileAction class allows the author to locate files that already exist on a user's computer, and then move or copy those files to a new location.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CopyFileAction.DeleteAfterCopy
member.summary: If TRUE, the source file is deleted after the copy operation.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CopyFileAction.Destination
member.summary: Fully qualified destination file name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_CopyFileAction.Source
member.summary: Fully qualified source file name.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DesktopMonitor
member.summary: The CIM_DesktopMonitor class represents the capabilities and management of the desktop monitor (CRT) logical device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Display
member.summary: The CIM_Display class is a parent class for grouping miscellaneous display devices.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_UserDevice
member.summary: The CIM_UserDevice class is a parent class from which other classes, such as CIM_Keyboard or CIM_DesktopMonitor, descend. User devices are logical devices that allow a computer system's user to input, view, or hear data.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_UserDevice.IsLocked
member.summary: If TRUE, the device is locked, preventing user input or output.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DesktopMonitor.Bandwidth
member.summary: Monitor's bandwidth in MHz. If unknown, use 0 (zero).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DesktopMonitor.DisplayType
member.summary: Type of desktop monitor or CRT.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DesktopMonitor.ScreenHeight
member.summary: Logical height of the display, in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DesktopMonitor.ScreenWidth
member.summary: Logical width of the display, in screen coordinates.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DiskDrive
member.summary: The CIM_DiskDrive class represents a physical disk drive as seen by the operating system. The disk drive features correspond to the logical and management characteristics of the drive, and in some cases, may not reflect the physical characteristics of the device. An interface to a physical drive is a member of this class. However, an object based on another logical device is not a member of this class.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DisketteDrive
member.summary: The CIM_DisketteDrive class represents the capabilities and management of a diskette drive.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DiskPartition
member.summary: The CIM_DiskPartition class represents a contiguous range of logical blocks that is identifiable by the operating system by way of the partition's type and subtype fields. Disk partitions should be directly realized by physical media (indicated by the CIM_RealizesDiskPartition association) or built on storage volumes.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent
member.summary: The CIM_StorageExtent class represents the capabilities and management of the various media that exist to store data and allow data retrieval. This parent class can represent the various components of RAID (hardware or software) or a raw logical extent on top of physical media.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent.Access
member.summary: Describes the read/write properties of the media.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent.BlockSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the blocks that form the storage extent. If variable block size, then the maximum block size, in bytes, should be specified. If the block size is unknown, or if a block concept is not valid (for example, for aggregate extents, memory, or logical disks), enter a 1 (one).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent.ErrorMethodology
member.summary: Free-form string that describes the type of error detection and correction supported by the storage extent.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent.NumberOfBlocks
member.summary: Number of consecutive blocks, each block the size of the value contained in the BlockSize property, that form the storage extent. Total size of the storage extent can be calculated by multiplying the value of the BlockSize property by the value of this property. If the value of BlockSize is 1 (one), this property is the total size of the storage extent.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_StorageExtent.Purpose
member.summary: Free form string that describes the media and its use.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DiskPartition.Bootable
member.summary: If TRUE, the disk partition is labeled as bootable. This does not mean that an operating system is loaded on the partition.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_DiskPartition.PrimaryPartition
member.summary: If TRUE, the disk partition is labeled as the primary partition for a computer system.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Fan
member.summary: The CIM_Fan class represents the capabilities and management of a fan cooling device.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Fan.SetSpeed(System.UInt64)
member.summary: The SetSpeed method requests that the fan speed be set to the value specified in the method's input parameter.
member.param: Requested fan speed, in revolutions per minute.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Fan.DesiredSpeed
member.summary: Requested fan speed, defined in revolutions per minute, when a variable speed fan is supported. The current speed is determined by a sensor (CIM_Tachometer) that is associated with the fan using the CIM_AssociatedSensor relationship.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Fan.VariableSpeed
member.summary: If TRUE, the fan supports variable speeds.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_HeatPipe
member.summary: The CIM_HeatPipe class represents the capabilities and management of a heat pipe cooling device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ
member.summary: The CIM_IRQ class represents an Intel architecture interrupt request line (IRQ).

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SystemResource
member.summary: The CIM_SystemResource class represents an entity managed by BIOS, or an operating system that is available for use by software and logical devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.Availability
member.summary: Availability of the IRQ.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.CSCreationClassName
member.summary: Scoping computer system's creation class name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.CSName
member.summary: Scoping computer system's name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.IRQNumber
member.summary: Part of the object's key value, IRQ number.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.Shareable
member.summary: If TRUE, the IRQ can be shared.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.TriggerLevel
member.summary: Indicates whether the interruption is triggered by the hardware signal going high or low.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_IRQ.TriggerType
member.summary: Type of interruption that can occur.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory
member.summary: The CIM_Memory class represents the capabilities and management of memory-related logical devices.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.AdditionalErrorData
member.summary: Array of octets that hold additional error information. An example is Error Checking and Correcting (ECC) Syndrome, or the return of the check bits if a CRC-based error methodology is used. In the latter case, if a single-bit error is recognized and the CRC algorithm is known, the exact bit that failed can be determined. This type of data (ECC Syndrome, check-bit or parity-bit data, or other vendor supplied information) is included in this field. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.CorrectableError
member.summary: If TRUE, the most recent error was correctable. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.EndingAddress
member.summary: Ending address referenced by an application or operating system and mapped by a memory controller for this memory object. The ending address is specified in kilobytes.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorAccess
member.summary: Memory access operation that caused the last error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorAddress
member.summary: Address of the last memory error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorData
member.summary: Data captured during the last erroneous memory access. The data occupies the first n octets of the array that are necessary to hold the number of bits specified by the ErrorTransferSize property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0, then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorDataOrder
member.summary: Order of data stored in the ErrorData property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0, then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorInfo
member.summary: Type of error that occurred most recently. The values 12 through 14 are undefined in the CIM schema because DMI mixes the semantics of the error type and whether it was correctable. Whether an error is correctable is indicated in the CorrectableError property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorResolution
member.summary: Specifies the range, in bytes, to which the last error can be resolved. For example, if error addresses are resolved to bit 11 (that is, on a typical page basis), then errors can be resolved to 4 KB boundaries and this property is set to 4000. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorTime
member.summary: Date and time that the last memory error occurred. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.ErrorTransferSize
member.summary: Size of the data transfer, in bits, that caused the last error. A value of 0 indicates no error. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property should be set to 0.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.OtherErrorDescription
member.summary: Free form string that provides information if the ErrorType property is set to 1 ("Other"). If it is not set to 1, then this string has no meaning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.StartingAddress
member.summary: Beginning address, referenced by an application or operating system and mapped by a memory controller, for this memory object. The starting address is specified in kilobytes.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Memory.SystemLevelAddress
member.summary: Indicates whether the address information in the ErrorAddress property is a system-level address (TRUE) or a physical address (FALSE). If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 ("OK"), then this property has no meaning.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO
member.summary: The CIM_MemoryMappedIO class represents computer architecture memory-mapped I/O. This class addresses memory and port I/O resources.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO.CSCreationClassName
member.summary: Scoping computer system's CreationClassName property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO.CSName
member.summary: Scoping computer system's Name property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO.EndingAddress
member.summary: Ending address of memory mapped I/O.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_MemoryMappedIO.StartingAddress
member.summary: Starting address of memory mapped I/O. The hardware resource identifier property should be set to this value to construct the mapped I/O resource key.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter
member.summary: The CIM_NetworkAdapter class is an abstract class that defines general networking hardware concepts (for example, permanent address or speed of operation). The information is conveyed using the CIM_DeviceSAPImplementation association. Network adapters and related endpoints represent the potential for connectivity among peers. The potential for connectivity is significantly different from the master or subordinate and controller or controlled-by relationships of CIM_Controller. Occasionally, however, a single device acts as both a network adapter and a controller, for example, when a fiber channel adapter operates as a computer system's SCSI controller. In which case, aspects of the device are network oriented and others are controller oriented. The controller and adapter classes should be instantiated and a device identity relationship should also be created to link the different aspects of the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter.AutoSense
member.summary: If TRUE, the network adapter can automatically determine the speed or other communications characteristics of the attached network media.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter.MaxSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed, in bits per second (BPS), for the network adapter.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter.NetworkAddresses
member.summary: List of network addresses for an adapter.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter.PermanentAddress
member.summary: Network address hard-coded into an adapter. The hard-coded address can be changed with a firmware upgrade or software configuration. If changed, the field should be updated when the change is made. This property should be left blank if no hard-coded address exists for the network adapter.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NetworkAdapter.Speed
member.summary: Estimate of the current bandwidth, in BPS. For endpoints that vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this property should contain the nominal bandwidth.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor
member.summary: The CIM_NumericSensor class represents a numeric sensor that returns numeric readings and optionally supports thresholds settings.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Sensor
member.summary: The CIM_Sensor class represents a hardware device that is capable of measuring the characteristics of a physical property (for example, the temperature or voltage characteristics of a unitary computer system).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.Accuracy
member.summary: Accuracy of the sensor for the measured property. Its value is recorded as plus or minus hundredths of a percent. This property, and the Resolution and Tolerance properties, are used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Accuracy can vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.CurrentReading
member.summary: Current value indicated by the sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.IsLinear
member.summary: If TRUE, the sensor is linear over its dynamic range.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.LowerThresholdCritical
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is between LowerThresholdCritical and LowerThresholdFatal, then the current state is critical.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.LowerThresholdFatal
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is below LowerThresholdFatal, then the current state is fatal.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.LowerThresholdNonCritical
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, then the sensor is reporting a normal value. If the CurrentReading property is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and LowerThresholdCritical, then the current state is non-critical.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.MaxReadable
member.summary: Largest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.MinReadable
member.summary: Smallest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.NominalReading
member.summary: Expected or "normal" value for the numeric sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.NormalMax
member.summary: Normal maximum range for the numeric sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.NormalMin
member.summary: Normal minimum range for the numeric sensor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.Resolution
member.summary: Ability of the sensor to resolve differences in the measured property. This value may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.Tolerance
member.summary: Tolerance of the sensor for the measured property. This property, and the Resolution and Accuracy properties, are used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Tolerance may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.UpperThresholdCritical
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is between UpperThresholdCritical and UpperThresholdFatal, then the current state is critical.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.UpperThresholdFatal
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is above UpperThresholdFatal, then the current state is fatal.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_NumericSensor.UpperThresholdNonCritical
member.summary: Threshold value that specifies the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If the CurrentReading property is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, then the sensor is reporting a normal value. If the CurrentReading property is between UpperThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdCritical, then the current state is non-critical.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PCVideoController
member.summary: The CIM_PCVideoController represents the capabilities and management of a personal computer video controller, a subtype of a video controller.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController
member.summary: The CIM_VideoController class represents the capabilities and management of the video controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.AcceleratorCapabilities
member.summary: Graphics and 3-D capabilities of the video controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CapabilityDescriptions
member.summary: Free-form strings that provide detailed descriptions for the video accelerator features indicated in the AcceleratorCapabilities array. Note Each entry of this array is related to the entry in the AcceleratorCapabilities array that is located at the same index.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits used to display each pixel.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentHorizontalResolution
member.summary: Current number of horizontal pixels.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentNumberOfColors
member.summary: Number of colors supported at the current resolution.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentNumberOfColumns
member.summary: If in character mode, number of columns for the video controller; otherwise, enter 0.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentNumberOfRows
member.summary: If in character mode, number of rows for the video controller; otherwise, enter 0.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentRefreshRate
member.summary: Current refresh rate, in hertz.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentScanMode
member.summary: Current scan mode.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.CurrentVerticalResolution
member.summary: Current number of vertical pixels.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.MaxMemorySupported
member.summary: Maximum amount of memory supported, in bytes.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.MaxRefreshRate
member.summary: Maximum refresh rate of the video controller, in hertz.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.MinRefreshRate
member.summary: Minimum refresh rate of the video controller, in hertz.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.NumberOfVideoPages
member.summary: Number of video pages supported given the current resolutions and available memory.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.VideoMemoryType
member.summary: Type of video memory.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_VideoController.VideoProcessor
member.summary: Free-form string that describes the video processor or controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PCVideoController.NumberOfColorPlanes
member.summary: Current number of color planes. If this value is not applicable for the current video configuration, enter 0.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PCVideoController.VideoArchitecture
member.summary: Video architecture.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PCVideoController.VideoMode
member.summary: Current video mode.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia
member.summary: The CIM_PhysicalMedia class represents types of documentation and storage medium, such as tapes, CD ROMs, and so on. This class is typically used to locate and manage removable media (versus media sealed with the media access device as a single package, such as hard disks). Sealed media, however, can also be modeled using this class when the media is associated with the physical package using the CIM_PackagedComponent relationship.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia.Capacity
member.summary: Number of bytes that can be read from, or written to, a media. This property is not applicable to hard copy (documentation) or cleaner media. Data compression should not be assumed, as it would increase the value in this property. For tapes, it should be assumed that no file marks or blank space areas are recorded on the media.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia.CleanerMedia
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical media is used for cleaning purposes, not data storage.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia.MediaDescription
member.summary: Additional detail related to the MediaType enumeration. For example, if value 3 ("QIC Cartridge") is specified, this property would indicate whether the tape is wide or 1/4 inch, pre-formatted, Travan compatible, and so on.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia.MediaType
member.summary: Type of physical media. The MediaDescription property provides more explicit definition of the media type.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMedia.WriteProtectOn
member.summary: If TRUE, the media is currently write-protected by a physical mechanism, such as a protect tab on a floppy disk.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory
member.summary: The CIM_PhysicalMemory class represents low-level memory devices, such as SIMMS, DIMMs, raw memory chips, and so on.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.BankLabel
member.summary: Labeled bank in which the memory is located. For example, "Bank 0" or "Bank A".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.Capacity
member.summary: Total capacity of the physical memory, in bytes.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.DataWidth
member.summary: Data width of the physical memory, in bits. A data width of 0 (zero) , and a total width of 8, indicates that the memory is solely used to provide error correction bits.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.InterleavePosition
member.summary: Position of the physical memory in an interleave. A value of 0 indicates non-interleaved, 1 indicates the first position, 2 indicates the second position, and so on. For example, in a 2:1 interleave, a value of 1 indicates that the memory is in the even position.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.MemoryType
member.summary: Type of physical memory.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.PositionInRow
member.summary: Position of the physical memory in a row. For example, if it takes two 8-bit memory devices to form a 16-bit row, then a value of 2 indicates that the memory is the second device. A value of 0 is an invalid value for this property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.Speed
member.summary: Speed of the physical memory, in nanoseconds.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PhysicalMemory.TotalWidth
member.summary: Total width, in bits, of the physical memory, including check or error correction bits. If there are no error correction bits, the value in this property should match that specified for the DataWidth property.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PointingDevice
member.summary: The CIM_PointingDevice class represents a device that points to regions on the display. Any device that manipulates a pointer, or points to regions on a visual display, is a member of this class. For example, a mouse, stylus, touch pad, or tablet.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PointingDevice.Handedness
member.summary: Configuration of the pointing device for right-hand or left-hand operation.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PointingDevice.NumberOfButtons
member.summary: Number of buttons on the pointing device. Example: "2"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PointingDevice.PointingType
member.summary: Type of the pointing device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_PointingDevice.Resolution
member.summary: Tracking resolution. Example: "0"

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer
member.summary: The CIM_Printer class represents the capabilities and management of the printer logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.AvailableJobSheets
member.summary: Describes all of the job sheets that are available on the printer. This can also be used to describe the banner that a printer might provide at the beginning of each job, or can describe other user specified options.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.Capabilities
member.summary: Printer capabilities.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CapabilityDescriptions
member.summary: Free-form strings that provide detailed explanations for any of the printer features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note Each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CharSetsSupported
member.summary: Available character sets for the output of text related to managing the printer. Strings provided in this property should conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ("Charset parameter") in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2), and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include "utf-8", "us-ascii", and "iso-8859-1". This property was added for Windows XP and later.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentCapabilities
member.summary: Finishings and other capabilities of the printer that are currently in use. Each entry in this property should also be listed in the Capabilities array.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentCharSet
member.summary: Current character set used for the output of text relating to management of the printer. The character set described by this property should also be listed in the CharsetsSupported property. The string specified by this property should conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ("Charset parameter") in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2), and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include "utf-8", "us-ascii", and "iso-8859-1".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentLanguage
member.summary: Current printer language being used; the language should also be listed in the LanguagesSupported property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentMimeType
member.summary: Mime type currently in use by the printer when the CurrentLanguage property is set to indicate that a mime type is in use.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentNaturalLanguage
member.summary: Current language in use by the printer for management. The language listed here should also be listed in NaturalLanguagesSupported.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.CurrentPaperType
member.summary: Paper type currently in use by the printer. The string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultCapabilities
member.summary: Default finishings and other capabilities of the printer. Each entry in this property should also be listed in the Capabilities array.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultCopies
member.summary: Number of copies that a single job will produce, unless otherwise specified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultLanguage
member.summary: Default printer language. The language should also be listed in the LanguagesSupported property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultMimeType
member.summary: Default mime type used by the printer when the DefaultLanguage property is set to indicate that a mime type is in use.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultNumberUp
member.summary: Number of print-stream pages that the printer will render onto a single media sheet, unless a job specifies otherwise.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DefaultPaperType
member.summary: Paper type that the printer will use if PrintJob does not specify a particular type. The string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.DetectedErrorState
member.summary: Printer error information.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.ErrorInformation
member.summary: Array that provides supplemental information for the current error state, indicated in the DetectedErrorState property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.HorizontalResolution
member.summary: Horizontal resolution in pixels-per-inch.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.JobCountSinceLastReset
member.summary: Printer jobs processed since the last reset. These jobs can be processed from one or more print queues.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.LanguagesSupported
member.summary: Print languages that are natively supported.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.MarkingTechnology
member.summary: Marking technology used by the printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.MaxCopies
member.summary: Maximum number of copies that can be produced by the printer from a single job.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.MaxNumberUp
member.summary: Maximum number of print-stream pages that the printer can render onto a single media sheet.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.MaxSizeSupported
member.summary: Largest job (as a byte stream) that the printer will accept in units of kilobytes. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no limit has been set.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.MimeTypesSupported
member.summary: Free-form strings that provide detailed explanations of mime types that are supported by the printer. If data is provided for this property, then the value 47 ("Mime"), should be included in the LanguagesSupported property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.NaturalLanguagesSupported
member.summary: Available languages for strings used by the printer for management information output. The strings should conform to RFC 1766. For example, "en" is used for English.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.PaperSizesSupported
member.summary: Types of paper supported.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.PaperTypesAvailable
member.summary: Free-form strings that specify the types of paper that are currently available for the printer. Each string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). Examples of valid strings are "iso-a4-colored" and "na-10x14-envelope". By definition, a paper size that is available and listed in the PaperTypesAvailable property should also appear in the PaperSizesSupported property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.PrinterStatus
member.summary: Status information, beyond that specified in the Availability property, for a printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.TimeOfLastReset
member.summary: Time of last printer reset.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Printer.VerticalResolution
member.summary: Vertical resolution in pixels-per-inch.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor
member.summary: The CIM_Processor class represents the capabilities and management of the processor logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.AddressWidth
member.summary: Processor address width, in bits.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.CurrentClockSpeed
member.summary: Current speed (in megahertz) of the processor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.DataWidth
member.summary: Processor data width, in bits.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.Family
member.summary: Processor family type.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.LoadPercentage
member.summary: Loading of the processor, averaged over the last minute, in a percentage.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.MaxClockSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed (in megahertz) of the processor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.OtherFamilyDescription
member.summary: Description of the processor family type. This property is used when the Family property is set to 1 ("Other"). This string should be set to null when the Family property is a value other than 1.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.Role
member.summary: Free-form string that describes the role of the processor. For example, "Central Processor" or "Math Processor".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.Stepping
member.summary: Free-form string that indicates the revision level of the processor within the processor family.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.UniqueId
member.summary: Globally unique identifier for the processor. This identifier can only be unique within a processor family.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Processor.UpgradeMethod
member.summary: CPU socket information, which includes data on how to upgrade the processor (if upgrades are supported).

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_RedundancyGroup
member.summary: The CIM_RedundancyGroup class represents a collection of managed system elements, which indicates that the aggregated components, together, provide redundancy. All elements aggregated in a redundancy group should be instantiations of the same object class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_RedundancyGroup.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_RedundancyGroup.RedundancyStatus
member.summary: Information about the state of the redundancy group.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Refrigeration
member.summary: The CIM_Refrigeration class represents the capabilities and management of a refrigeration cooling device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SCSIController
member.summary: The CIM_SCSIController class represents the capabilities and management of the SCSI controller logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SCSIController.ControllerTimeouts
member.summary: Number of SCSI controller time-outs that have occurred since the last reset.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SCSIController.MaxDataWidth
member.summary: Maximum data width, in bits, supported by the SCSI controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SCSIController.MaxTransferRate
member.summary: Maximum transfer rate, in bits-per-second, supported by the SCSI controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SCSIController.ProtectionManagement
member.summary: Indicates whether the SCSI controller provides redundancy or protection against device failures.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SerialController
member.summary: The CIM_SerialController class represents the capabilities and management of the serial port logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SerialController.Capabilities
member.summary: Chip-level compatibility for the serial controller. This property describes buffering and other capabilities of the serial controller, that may be inherent in the chip hardware. This property is an enumerated integer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SerialController.CapabilityDescriptions
member.summary: Free-form strings that provide detailed explanations for the serial controller features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note Each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SerialController.MaxBaudRate
member.summary: Maximum baud rate, in bits-per-second, supported by the serial controller.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service
member.summary: The CIM_Service class represents a logical element that contains information to represent and manage the functionality provided by a device or software feature. A service is a general-purpose object to configure and manage the implementation of functionality; it is not the functionality itself.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.StartService
member.summary: The StartService method puts the service in a started state.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.StopService
member.summary: The StopService method stops the service represented by the object derived from CIM_Service.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.Started
member.summary: If TRUE, the service has started.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.StartMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the service is automatically started (for example, by an operating system) or only started upon request.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.SystemCreationClassName
member.summary: Scoping system's creation class name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Service.SystemName
member.summary: Name of the system that hosts the service.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ServiceAccessPoint
member.summary: The CIM_ServiceAccessPoint class represents the ability to use or invoke a service. Access points represent services that are available for use by other entities.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.SystemCreationClassName
member.summary: Scoping system's creation class name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.SystemName
member.summary: Scoping system's name.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.Type
member.summary: Type of SAP, such as attached or redirected.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Setting
member.summary: The CIM_Setting class represents configuration-related and operational parameters for one or more managed system elements. A managed system element can have multiple setting objects associated with it. The current operational values for an element's parameters are reflected by properties in the element itself or by properties in its associations. These properties do not have to be the same values present in the setting object. For example, a modem may have a setting baud rate of 56 kilobytes per second, but be operating at 19.2 kilobytes per second.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Setting.Caption
member.summary: Short textual description of the CIM_Setting object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Setting.Description
member.summary: Textual description of the CIM_Setting object.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Setting.SettingID
member.summary: Identifier by which the CIM_Setting object is known.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_SpareGroup
member.summary: The CIM_SpareGroup class is derived from the CIM_RedundancyGroup class and indicates that one or more of the aggregated elements can be spared. Spares are defined using the CIM_ActsAsSpare association. An example of a spare is the use of redundant NICs in a computer system, where one NIC is primary and the other is spare. The primary NIC would be a member of the spare group, associated using the CIM_RedundancyComponent class, and the other NIC would be associated using the CIM_ActsAsSpare relationship.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System
member.summary: The CIM_System class aggregates an enumerable set of managed system elements. The aggregation operates as a functional whole. Within any particular subclass of the system, there is a well-defined list of managed system element classes whose instances must be aggregated. The CIM_System object and its derivatives are top-level objects of CIM. They provide the scope for numerous components and are required to have unique system keys.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System.CreationClassName
member.summary: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, this property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System.NameFormat
member.summary: Identifies how the system name was generated, using the subclass heuristic.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System.PrimaryOwnerContact
member.summary: How the primary system owner can be reached (for example, phone number or email address).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System.PrimaryOwnerName
member.summary: Name of the primary system owner.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_System.Roles
member.summary: Roles the system plays in the information technology environment. Subclasses of the system can override this property to define explicit role values. Alternately, a working group can describe the heuristics, conventions, and guidelines for specifying roles. For example, for an instance of a networking system, this property might contain the string "Switch" or "Bridge".

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_TapeDrive
member.summary: The CIM_TapeDrive class represents a tape drive on the system. Tape drives are primarily distinguished in that they can only be accessed sequentially.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_TapeDrive.EOTWarningZoneSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the area designated as end-of-tape. Access in this area generates an end-of-tape warning.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_TapeDrive.MaxPartitionCount
member.summary: Maximum partition count for the tape drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_TapeDrive.Padding
member.summary: Number of bytes inserted between blocks on a tape media.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_TemperatureSensor
member.summary: The CIM_TemperatureSensor class exists for backward compatibility with earlier CIM schema definitions. With additions to the CIM_Sensor and CIM_NumericSensor classes in version 2.2, it is no longer necessary. A temperature sensor can be defined by setting the SensorType property, inherited from CIM_Sensor, to 2 ("Temperature"). Other properties of this class are hardcoded as constant values that correspond to definitions in the sensor hierarchy.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_USBController
member.summary: The CIM_USBController class represents the capabilities and management of a USB controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_USBController.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the USB controller manufacturer.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.CoolingDevice.Win32_Fan
member.summary: The Win32_Fan WMI class represents the properties of a fan device in the computer system. For example, the CPU cooling fan.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.CoolingDevice.Win32_HeatPipe
member.summary: The Win32_HeatPipe WMI class represents the properties of a heat pipe cooling device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.CoolingDevice.Win32_Refrigeration
member.summary: The Win32_Refrigeration WMI class represents the properties of a refrigeration device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.CoolingDevice.Win32_TemperatureProbe
member.summary: The Win32_TemperatureProbe WMI class represents the properties of a temperature sensor (electronic thermometer). Most of the information that the Win32_TemperatureProbe WMI class provides comes from SMBIOS. Real-time readings for the CurrentReading property cannot be extracted from SMBIOS tables. For this reason, current implementations of WMI do not populate the CurrentReading property. The CurrentReading property's presence is reserved for future use.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_Keyboard
member.summary: The Win32_Keyboard WMI class represents a keyboard installed on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Keyboard
member.summary: The CIM_Keyboard class represents the capabilities and management of the keyboard logical device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Keyboard.Layout
member.summary: Free-form string that indicates the format and layout of the keyboard.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Keyboard.NumberOfFunctionKeys
member.summary: Number of function keys on the keyboard.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.CIM.CIM_Keyboard.Password
member.summary: Integer that indicates whether a hardware-level password is enabled on the keyboard to prevent local input.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice
member.summary: The Win32_PointingDevice WMI class represents an input device used to point to and select regions on the display of a computer system running Windows. Any device used to manipulate a pointer, or point to the display on a computer system running Windows is a member of this class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.DeviceInterface
member.summary: Type of interface used for the pointing device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.DoubleSpeedThreshold
member.summary: One of two acceleration values. The sensitivity of the pointing device doubles (toggles from the first to the second value) when the pointing device moves a distance greater than this threshold value.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.HardwareType
member.summary: Type of hardware used for the Windows pointing device. Example: "MICROSOFT PS2 MOUSE"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.InfFileName
member.summary: Name of the .inf file for the Windows pointing device. Example: "ab.inf"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.InfSection
member.summary: Section of the .inf file that holds configuration information for the Windows pointing device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the processor's manufacturer. Example: "GenuineSilicon"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.QuadSpeedThreshold
member.summary: One of two acceleration threshold values. The system doubles the speed of the pointer movement when the pointer device moves a distance greater than this value. Because this speed increase occurs after the DoubleSpeedThreshold value has been met, the pointer effectively moves at four times its original speed.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.SampleRate
member.summary: Rate at which the pointing device is polled for input information.(Hertz)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.InputDevice.Win32_PointingDevice.Synch
member.summary: Length of time after which the next interrupt is assumed to indicate the start of a new device packet (partial packets are discarded). In the event that an interrupt is lost, this allows the pointing device driver to synchronize its internal representation of the packet state with the hardware state.(100 Nanoseconds)

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_AutochkSetting
