member.summary: The Win32_AutochkSetting WMI class represents the settings for the autocheck operation of a disk.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_AutochkSetting.UserInputDelay
member.summary: User input delay for autocheck.(Seconds)

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive
member.summary: The Win32_CDROMDrive WMI class represents a CD-ROM drive on a computer system running Windows. Be aware that the name of the drive does not correspond to the logical drive letter assigned to the device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.Drive
member.summary: Drive letter of the CD-ROM drive. Example: "d:\"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.DriveIntegrity
member.summary: If True, files can be accurately read from the CD device. This is achieved by reading a block of data twice and comparing the data against itself.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.FileSystemFlags
member.summary: This property is obsolete. In place of this property, use FileSystemFlagsEx.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.FileSystemFlagsEx
member.summary: File system flags associated with the Windows CD-ROM drive. This parameter can be any combination of flags, but FS_FILE_COMPRESSION and FS_VOL_IS_COMPRESSED are mutually exclusive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.Id
member.summary: Drive letter that uniquely identifies this CD-ROM drive. Example: "d:\"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: "PLEXTOR"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.MaximumComponentLength
member.summary: Maximum length of a filename component supported by the Windows CD-ROM drive. A file name component the portion of a file name between backslashes. The value can be used to indicate that long names are supported by the specified file system. For example, for a FAT file system supporting long names, the function stores the value 255, rather than the previous 8.3 indicator. Long names can also be supported on systems that use the NTFS file system. Example: 255

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.MediaLoaded
member.summary: If True, a CD-ROM is in the drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.MediaType
member.summary: Type of media that can be used or accessed by this device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.MfrAssignedRevisionLevel
member.summary: Firmware revision level that is assigned by the manufacturer. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.RevisionLevel
member.summary: Firmware revision level of the Windows CD-ROM drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.SCSIBus
member.summary: SCSI bus number for the disk drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.SCSILogicalUnit
member.summary: SCSI logical unit number (LUN) of the disk drive. The LUN is used to designate which SCSI controller is being accessed in a system with more than one controller being used. The SCSI device identifier is similar, but is the designation for multiple devices on one controller. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.SCSIPort
member.summary: SCSI port number of the disk drive. Example: 1

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.SCSITargetId
member.summary: SCSI identifier number of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.SerialNumber
member.summary: Number supplied by the manufacturer that identifies the physical media. Example: WD-WM3493798728. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.Size
member.summary: Size of the disk drive.(Bytes)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.TransferRate
member.summary: Transfer rate of the CD-ROM drive. A value of -1 indicates that the rate cannot be determined. When this happens, the CD is not in the drive. (KiloBytes per Second)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.VolumeName
member.summary: Volume name of the Windows CD-ROM drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_CDROMDrive.VolumeSerialNumber
member.summary: Volume serial number of the media in the CD-ROM drive. Example: A8C3-D032

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive
member.summary: The Win32_DiskDrive WMI class represents a physical disk drive as seen by a computer running the Windows operating system. Any interface to a Windows physical disk drive is a descendent (or member) of this class. The features of the disk drive seen through this object correspond to the logical and management characteristics of the drive. In some cases, this may not reflect the actual physical characteristics of the device. Any object based on another logical device would not be a member of this class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.BytesPerSector
member.summary: Number of bytes in each sector for the physical disk drive. Example: 512

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.FirmwareRevision
member.summary: Revision for the disk drive firmware that is assigned by the manufacturer. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Index
member.summary: Physical drive number of the given drive. This property is filled by the GetDriveMapInfo method. A value of 0xFF indicates that the given drive does not map to a physical drive. Example: 1

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.InterfaceType
member.summary: Interface type of physical disk drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the disk drive manufacturer. Example: "Seagate"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.MediaLoaded
member.summary: If True, the media for a disk drive is loaded, which means that the device has a readable file system and is accessible. For fixed disk drives, this property will always be TRUE.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.MediaType
member.summary: Type of media used or accessed by this device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Model
member.summary: Manufacturer's model number of the disk drive. Example: "ST32171W"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Partitions
member.summary: Number of partitions on this physical disk drive that are recognized by the operating system. Example: 2

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SCSIBus
member.summary: SCSI bus number of the disk drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SCSILogicalUnit
member.summary: SCSI logical unit number (LUN) of the disk drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SCSIPort
member.summary: SCSI port number of the disk drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SCSITargetId
member.summary: SCSI identifier number of the disk drive. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SectorsPerTrack
member.summary: Number of sectors in each track for this physical disk drive. Example: 63

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.SerialNumber
member.summary: Number allocated by the manufacturer to identify the physical media. Example: WD-WM3493798728 Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Signature
member.summary: Disk identification. This property can be used to identify a shared resource. This property has been added for Windows XP.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.Size
member.summary: Size of the disk drive. It is calculated by multiplying the total number of cylinders, tracks in each cylinder, sectors in each track, and bytes in each sector.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.TotalCylinders
member.summary: Total number of cylinders on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 657

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.TotalHeads
member.summary: Total number of heads on the disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.TotalSectors
member.summary: Total number of sectors on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 2649024

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.TotalTracks
member.summary: Total number of tracks on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 42048

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_DiskDrive.TracksPerCylinder
member.summary: Number of tracks in each cylinder on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 64

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_FloppyDrive
member.summary: The Win32_FloppyDrive WMI class manages the functions of a floppy disk drive.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_FloppyDrive.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the manufacturer of the floppy disk drive. Example: "Acme"

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_PhysicalMedia
member.summary: The Win32_PhysicalMedia class represents any type of documentation or storage medium, such as tapes, CD ROMs, and so on. To obtain the characteristics of the media in a CD drive, such as whether it is writeable, use Win32_CDROMDrive and the Capabilities property.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive
member.summary: The Win32_TapeDrive WMI class represents a tape drive on a computer system running Windows. Tape drives are primarily distinguished by the fact that they can only be accessed sequentially.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.Compression
member.summary: If TRUE, hardware data compression is enabled.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.ECC
member.summary: If TRUE, the device supports hardware error correction.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.FeaturesHigh
member.summary: High-order 32 bits of the device features flag.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.FeaturesLow
member.summary: Low-order 32 bits of the device features flag.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.Id
member.summary: Manufacturer's identifying name of the Windows CD ROM drive. Example: "PLEXTOR CD-ROM PX-12CS 1.01"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: "PLEXTOR"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.MediaType
member.summary: Media type used by (or accessed by) this device. In this case, it is set to "Tape Drive".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MassStorage.Win32_TapeDrive.ReportSetMarks
member.summary: If TRUE, setmark reporting is enabled. Setmark reporting makes use of a specialized recorded element that does not contain user data. This recorded element is used to provide a segmentation scheme that is hierarchically superior to filemarks. Setmarks provide faster positioning on high-capacity tapes.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_1394Controller
member.summary: The Win32_1394Controller WMI class represents the capabilities and management of a 1394 controller. IEEE 1394 is a specification for a high-speed serial bus.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_1394Controller.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the controller.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_1394ControllerDevice
member.summary: The Win32_1394ControllerDevice association WMI class relates the high-speed serial bus (IEEE 1394 Firewire) Controller and the CIM_LogicalDevice instance connected to it. This serial bus provides enhanced connectivity for a wide range of devices, including consumer audio or video components, storage peripherals, other computers, and portable devices. IEEE 1394 has been adopted by the consumer electronics industry and provides a Plug and Play-compatible expansion interface.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_AllocatedResource
member.summary: The Win32_AllocatedResource association WMI class relates a logical device to a system resource. This class is used to discover which resources, such as IRQs or DMA channels, are in use by a specific device. This class is obsolete. In place of this class, you should use the properties in the Win32_PNPAllocatedResource class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_AllocatedResource.Antecedent
member.summary: Reference to the CIM_SystemResource instance representing the properties of a system resource available to the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_Dependency.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_AllocatedResource.Dependent
member.summary: Reference to the CIM_LogicalDevice instance representing the properties of the logical device that is using the system resources assigned to it. This property is inherited from CIM_Dependency.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS
member.summary: The Win32_BIOS WMI class represents the attributes of the computer system's basic input/output services (BIOS) that are installed on a computer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.BiosCharacteristics
member.summary: Array of BIOS characteristics supported by the system as defined by the System Management BIOS Reference Specification.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.BIOSVersion
member.summary: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Array of the complete system BIOS information. In many computers there can be several version strings that are stored in the registry and represent the system BIOS information.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.CurrentLanguage
member.summary: Name of the current BIOS language.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.InstallableLanguages
member.summary: Number of languages available for installation on this system. Language may determine properties such as the need for Unicode and bidirectional text.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.ListOfLanguages
member.summary: Array of names of available BIOS-installable languages.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Release date of the Windows BIOS in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format of YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.MMMMMM(+-)OOO.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.SMBIOSBIOSVersion
member.summary: BIOS version as reported by SMBIOS.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.SMBIOSMajorVersion
member.summary: Major SMBIOS version number. This property is NULL if SMBIOS is not found.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.SMBIOSMinorVersion
member.summary: Minor SMBIOS version number. This property is NULL if SMBIOS is not found.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_BIOS.SMBIOSPresent
member.summary: If true, the SMBIOS is available on this computer system.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_DeviceMemoryAddress
member.summary: The Win32_DeviceMemoryAddress WMI class represents a device memory address on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SystemMemoryResource
member.summary: The Win32_SystemMemoryResource abstract WMI class represents a system memory resource on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_DeviceMemoryAddress.MemoryType
member.summary: Characteristics of the memory resource on the computer system running Windows. Values are the following.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_IDEController
member.summary: The Win32_IDEController WMI class manages the capabilities of an integrated device electronics (IDE) controller device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_IDEController.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the IDE controller device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_IRQResource
member.summary: The Win32_IRQResource WMI class represents an interrupt request line (IRQ) number on a computer system running Windows. An interrupt request is a signal sent to the CPU by a device or program for time critical events. IRQ can be hardware-based or software-based.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_IRQResource.Hardware
member.summary: If TRUE, the interrupt is hardware or software based. A hardware IRQ is a physical wire from the peripheral to the programmable interrupt controller (PIC) chip through which the CPU can be notified of time-critical events. Some IRQ lines are reserved for standard devices, such as the keyboard, floppy disk drives, and the system clock. A software interrupt allows applications to get the attention of the processor.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_IRQResource.Vector
member.summary: Vector of the Windows IRQ resource. A vector contains the memory address to the function that will execute once the interrupt request is acknowledged by the CPU.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_MotherboardDevice
member.summary: The Win32_MotherboardDevice WMI class represents a device that contains the central components of the Windows computer system.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_MotherboardDevice.PrimaryBusType
member.summary: Primary bus type of the motherboard. Example: "PCI"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_MotherboardDevice.RevisionNumber
member.summary: Revision number of the motherboard. Example: "00"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_MotherboardDevice.SecondaryBusType
member.summary: Secondary bus type of the motherboard. Example: "ISA"

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_OnBoardDevice
member.summary: The Win32_OnBoardDevice WMI class represents common adapter devices built into the motherboard (system board).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_OnBoardDevice.DeviceType
member.summary: Type of device being represented.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_OnBoardDevice.Enabled
member.summary: If TRUE, the on-board device is available for use.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PhysicalMemory
member.summary: The Win32_PhysicalMemory WMI class represents a physical memory device located on a computer system and available to the operating system.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PhysicalMemory.DeviceLocator
member.summary: Label of the socket or circuit board that holds the memory. Example: "SIMM 3"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PhysicalMemory.InterleaveDataDepth
member.summary: Unsigned 16-bit integer maximum number of consecutive rows of data that are accessed in a single interleaved transfer from the memory device. If the value is 0 (zero), the memory is not interleaved.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PhysicalMemory.TypeDetail
member.summary: Type of physical memory represented.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PnPAllocatedResource
member.summary: The Win32_PnPAllocatedResource association WMI class represents an association between logical devices and system resources. This class is used to discover the resources that are in-use by a specific device, such as an Interrupt ReQuest (IRQ) or a Direct Memory Access (DMA) channel.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PortResource
member.summary: The Win32_PortResource WMI class represents an I/O port on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_PortResource.Alias
member.summary: If TRUE, this instance represents one of the ranges with an alias. If FALSE, the instance represents a base port address. A base port address is a predetermined port address dedicated to a specific service or device. A port alias address is one that a device responds to as if it were the actual address of an I/O port.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController
member.summary: The Win32_SCSIController WMI class represents a SCSI controller on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController.DeviceMap
member.summary: Order in which the devices are listed with this SCSI controller.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController.DriverName
member.summary: Driver file name of the SCSI controller. Example: "Adaptec"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController.HardwareVersion
member.summary: Hardware version number of the SCSI controller. Example: "1.25"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController.Index
member.summary: Index number of the SCSI controller in the system registry. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SCSIController.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the SCSI controller manufacturer. Example: "Adaptec"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_DriverForDevice.Antecedent
member.summary: Reference to the Win32_Printer instance that represents the printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_DriverForDevice.Dependent
member.summary: Reference to the Win32_PrinterDriver instance that represents the printer driver for the printer.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver
member.summary: The Win32_PrinterDriver WMI class represents the drivers for a Win32_Printer instance.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.AddPrinterDriver(WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver)
member.summary: The AddPrinterDriver class method creates a new printer driver. Note When using the AddPrinterDriver method you must use SeLoadDriverPrivilege to load or unload a device driver.
member.param: Information needed to create the printer driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.ConfigFile
member.summary: Configuration file for this printer driver. Example: "pscrptui.dll"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.DataFile
member.summary: Data file for this printer driver. Example: "qms810.ppd"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.DefaultDataType
member.summary: Default data type for this printer driver. Example: "EMF"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.DependentFiles
member.summary: Array of dependent files for this printer driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.DriverPath
member.summary: Path for this printer driver. Example: "C:\\drivers\\pscript.dll"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.FilePath
member.summary: Path to the INF file being used. Example: "c:\\temp\\driver"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.HelpFile
member.summary: Help file for this printer driver. Example: "pscrptui.hlp"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.InfName
member.summary: Name of the INF file being used. The default is to use an operating system provided printer INF file. A different file name is used if the driver is provided directly by the manufacturer of the printer and not the operating system. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: The default name is "ntprint.inf".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.MonitorName
member.summary: Name of the monitor for this printer driver. Example: "PJL monitor"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.OEMUrl
member.summary: World Wide Web (WWW) link to the printer manufacturer's website. Note that this property is not populated when the Win32.inf file is used, and is only applicable for drivers provided directly from the manufacturer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.SupportedPlatform
member.summary: Operating environments that the driver is intended for. Example: "Windows NT x86".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_PrinterDriver.Version
member.summary: Operating system version for the printer driver.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort
member.summary: The Win32_SerialPort WMI class represents a serial port on a computer system running Windows.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.Binary
member.summary: If TRUE, the serial port is configured for binary data transfer. Because the Windows API does not support nonbinary mode transfers, this property must be TRUE.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.MaximumInputBufferSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the serial port driver's internal input buffer. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no maximum value is imposed by the serial provider.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.MaximumOutputBufferSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the serial port driver's internal output buffer. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no maximum value is imposed by the serial provider.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.OSAutoDiscovered
member.summary: If TRUE, the instances of this class were automatically discovered by the operating system. If, for example, hardware was added through Control Panel, the operating system finds instances of this class by querying hardware from the instances of this class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.ProviderType
member.summary: Communications provider type.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableBaudRate
member.summary: If TRUE, the baud rate can be changed for this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableDataBits
member.summary: If TRUE, data bits can be set for this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableFlowControl
member.summary: If TRUE, flow control can be set for this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableParity
member.summary: If TRUE, parity can be set for this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableParityCheck
member.summary: If TRUE, parity checking can be set for this serial port (if parity checking is supported).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableRLSD
member.summary: If TRUE, Received Line Signal Detect (RLSD) can be set for this serial port (if RLSD is supported).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SettableStopBits
member.summary: If TRUE, stop bits can be set for this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.Supports16BitMode
member.summary: If TRUE, 16-bit mode is supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsDTRDSR
member.summary: If TRUE, data terminal ready (DTR) and data set ready (DSR) signals are supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsElapsedTimeouts
member.summary: If TRUE, elapsed time-outs are supported on this serial port. Elapsed timeouts track the total amount of time between data transmissions.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsIntTimeouts
member.summary: If TRUE, interval time-outs are supported. An interval timeout is the amount of time allowed to elapse between the arrival of each piece of data.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsParityCheck
member.summary: If TRUE, parity checking is supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsRLSD
member.summary: If TRUE, Received Line Signal Detect (RLSD) is supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsRTSCTS
member.summary: If TRUE, ready to send (RTS) and clear to send (CTS) signals are supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsSpecialCharacters
member.summary: If TRUE, serial port control characters are supported. These characters signal events rather than data. These characters are not displayable and are set by the driver. They include EofChar, ErrorChar, BreakChar, EventChar, XonChar, and XoffChar.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsXOnXOff
member.summary: If TRUE, XON or XOFF flow-control is supported on this serial port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_SerialPort.SupportsXOnXOffSet
member.summary: If TRUE, the communications provider supports configuration of the XONor XOFF flow-control setting.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.MotherboardControllerPort.Win32_USBController
member.summary: The Win32_USBController WMI class manages the capabilities of a universal serial bus (USB) controller.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter
member.summary: The Win32_NetworkAdapter class is deprecated. Use the MSFT_NetAdapter class instead. The Win32_NetworkAdapter WMI class represents a network adapter of a computer running a Windows operating system. Win32_NetworkAdapter only supplies IPv4 data. For more information, see IPv6 and IPv4 Support in WMI.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.Disable
member.summary: The Disable method disables the network adapter.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.Enable
member.summary: The Enable method enables the network adapter.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.AdapterType
member.summary: Network medium in use.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.AdapterTypeID
member.summary: Network medium in use. Returns the same information as the AdapterType property, except that the information is in the form of an integer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.GUID
member.summary: Globally unique identifier for the connection. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.Index
member.summary: Index number of the network adapter, stored in the system registry. Example: 0

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.Installed
member.summary: If True, the network adapter is installed in the system.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.InterfaceIndex
member.summary: Index value that uniquely identifies the local network interface. The value in this property is the same as the value in the InterfaceIndex property in the instance of Win32_IP4RouteTable that represents the network interface in the route table. Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.MACAddress
member.summary: Media access control address for this network adapter. A MAC address is a unique 48-bit number assigned to the network adapter by the manufacturer. It uniquely identifies this network adapter and is used for mapping TCP/IP network communications.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the network adapter's manufacturer. Example: "3COM"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.MaxNumberControlled
member.summary: Maximum number of directly addressable ports supported by this network adapter. A value of 0 (zero) should be used if the number is unknown.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.NetConnectionID
member.summary: Name of the network connection as it appears in the Network Connections Control Panel program. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is read-only.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.NetConnectionStatus
member.summary: State of the network adapter connection to the network. Windows XP with SP3 and later: This property returns a value of 2 for a client that is connected to an authenticated port. Windows XP with SP2 and earlier: This property returns a value of 9 for a client that is connected to an authenticated port.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.NetEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the adapter is enabled or not. If True, the adapter is enabled. You can enable or disable the NIC by using the Enable and Disable methods. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.PhysicalAdapter
member.summary: Indicates whether the adapter is a physical or a logical adapter. If True, the adapter is physical. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This property is not available.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.ProductName
member.summary: Product name of the network adapter. Example: "Fast EtherLink XL"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.ServiceName
member.summary: Service name of the network adapter. This name is usually shorter than the full product name. Example: "Elnkii"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.NetworkingDevice.Win32_NetworkAdapter.TimeOfLastReset
member.summary: Date and time the network adapter was last reset.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer
member.summary: The Win32_Printer WMI class represents a device connected to a computer running on a Microsoft Windows operating system that can produce a printed image or text on paper or other medium.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.AddPrinterConnection(System.String)
member.summary: The AddPrinterConnection WMI class method provides a connection to an existing printer on the network, and adds it to the list of available printers.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.CancelAllJobs
member.summary: The CancelAllJobs WMI class method removes all jobs, including the one currently printing from the queue.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Pause
member.summary: The Pause WMI class method pauses the print queue. No jobs can print until the queue is resumed.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PrintTestPage
member.summary: The PrintTestPage WMI class method prints a test page.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.RenamePrinter(System.String)
member.summary: The RenamePrinter WMI class method renames a printer.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Resume
member.summary: The Resume WMI class method resumes a paused print queue.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.SetDefaultPrinter
member.summary: The SetDefaultPrinter WMI class method sets the default system printer for the user calling the method.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Attributes
member.summary: Bitmap of attributes for a Windows-based printing device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.AveragePagesPerMinute
member.summary: Printing rate, in average number of pages per minute, that a printer can produce output.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Comment
member.summary: Comment for a print queue. Example: Color printer

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Default
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is the default printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.DefaultPriority
member.summary: Default priority value assigned to each print job.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Direct
member.summary: If TRUE, the print job is sent directly to the printer. If FALSE, the print job is spooled.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.DoCompleteFirst
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer starts jobs that are finished spooling. If FALSE, the printer starts jobs in the order that the jobs are received.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.DriverName
member.summary: Name of the Windows printer driver. Example: Windows Fax Driver

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.EnableBIDI
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer can print bidirectionally.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.EnableDevQueryPrint
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer holds documents in the queue when document and printer setups do not match.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.ExtendedDetectedErrorState
member.summary: Reports standard error information. Additional information should be recorded in DetectedErrorState.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.ExtendedPrinterStatus
member.summary: Status information for a printer that is different from information specified in the Availability property.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Hidden
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is hidden from network users.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.KeepPrintedJobs
member.summary: If TRUE, the print spooler does not delete the completed jobs.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Local
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is not attached to a network. If both the Local and Network properties are set to TRUE, then the printer is a network printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Location
member.summary: Physical location of the printer. Example: Bldg. 38, Room 1164

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Network
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is a network printer. If both the Local and Network properties are set to TRUE, then the printer is a network printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Parameters
member.summary: Optional parameters for the print processor. Example: Copies=2

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PortName
member.summary: Port that is used to transmit data to a printer. If a printer is connected to more than one port, the names of each port are separated by commas. Example: LPT1:, LPT2:, LPT3:

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PrinterPaperNames
member.summary: Array of paper sizes supported by the printer. The printer-specified names are used to represent supported paper sizes. Example: B5 (JIS)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PrinterState
member.summary: One of the possible states relating to this printer. This property is obsolete. In place of this property, use PrinterStatus.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PrintJobDataType
member.summary: Data type of a print job waiting for the Windows-based printing device.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.PrintProcessor
member.summary: Name of the print spooler that handles print jobs. Example: SPOOLSS.DLL

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Priority
member.summary: Priority of the printer. Jobs on a higher priority printer are scheduled first.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Published
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is published in the network directory service.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Queued
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer buffers and queues print jobs.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.RawOnly
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer accepts only raw data to be spooled.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.SeparatorFile
member.summary: Name of the file used to create a separator page. This page is used to separate print jobs sent to the printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.ServerName
member.summary: Name of the server that controls the printer. If this string is NULL, the printer is controlled locally.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.Shared
member.summary: If TRUE, the printer is available as a shared network resource.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.ShareName
member.summary: Share name of the Windows-based printing device. Example: \\PRINTSERVER1\PRINTER2

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.SpoolEnabled
member.summary: This property is obsolete; do not use. If TRUE, spooling is enabled for printer.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.StartTime
member.summary: Date and time that a printer can start to print a jobif the printer is limited to print at specific times. This value is expressed as the time elapsed since 12:00 AM GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.UntilTime
member.summary: Date and time that a printer can print the last jobif the printer is limited to print at specific times. This value is expressed as the time elapsed since 12:00 AM GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.Printing.Win32_Printer.WorkOffline
member.summary: If TRUE, you can queue print jobs on the computer when the printer is offline.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DesktopMonitor
member.summary: The Win32_DesktopMonitor WMI class represents the type of monitor or display device attached to the computer system. Starting with Windows Vista, properties of this class replace Win32_DisplayConfiguration. Starting with Windows Vista, hardware that is not compatible with Windows Display Driver Model (WDDM) returns inaccurate property values for instances of this class. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This class returns data supplied by hardware compatible with Windows Device Driver Model (WDDM).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DesktopMonitor.MonitorManufacturer
member.summary: Name of the monitor manufacturer. Example: "NEC"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DesktopMonitor.MonitorType
member.summary: Type of monitor. Example: "NEC 5FGp"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DesktopMonitor.PixelsPerXLogicalInch
member.summary: Resolution along the x-axis (horizontal direction) of the monitor.(Pixels per Logical Inch)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DesktopMonitor.PixelsPerYLogicalInch
member.summary: Resolution along the y-axis (vertical direction) of the monitor.(Pixels per Logical Inch)

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration
member.summary: [The Win32_DisplayConfiguration WMI class is no longer available for use as of Windows Vista. Instead, use the properties in the Win32_VideoController, Win32_DesktopMonitor, and CIM_VideoControllerResolution classes.] Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: The Win32_DisplayConfiguration WMI class represents configuration information for the display device on a computer running on a Windows operating system. Hardware that is not compatible with Windows Display Driver Model (WDDM) returns inaccurate property values for instances of this class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.BitsPerPel
member.summary: Number of bits used to represent the color in this configuration (bits per pixel). Example: 8

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.DeviceName
member.summary: Name of the display device. MaxLen (260)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.DisplayFlags
member.summary: If TRUE, the display device is color (versus monochrome), and noninterlaced (versus interlaced), by masking its value with the DM_GRAYSCALE and DM_INTERLACED masks respectively.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.DisplayFrequency
member.summary: The vertical refresh rate for the display. The refresh rate for a monitor is the number of times the screen is redrawn per second (frequency). (Hertz)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.DitherType
member.summary: Dither type of the display. This property can assume predefined values of 1 to 5, or driver-defined values from 6 to 256. Line art dithering is a special dithering method that produces well-defined borders between black, white, and gray scalings. It is not suitable for images that include continuous graduations in intensity and hue (such as scanned photographs).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.DriverVersion
member.summary: Release version of the display driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.ICMIntent
member.summary: Value of one of the three possible color matching methods (intents) that should be used by default. This property is used primarily for non-ICM applications. ICM applications establish intents by using the ICM functions. This property can assume predefined values of 1 to 3, or driver-defined values from 4 to 256.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.ICMMethod
member.summary: How ICM is handled. For a non-ICM application, this property indicates if ICM is enabled or disabled. For ICM applications, the system examines this property to determine which part of the computer system handles ICM support.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.LogPixels
member.summary: Number of pixels per logical inch. This property is valid only with devices that work with pixels (this excludes devices such as printers).(Pixels)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.PelsHeight
member.summary: Height of the displayable surface.(Pixels)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.PelsWidth
member.summary: Width of the displayable surface.(Pixels)

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_DisplayConfiguration.SpecificationVersion
member.summary: Version number of the initialization data for the Windows display device.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController
member.summary: The Win32_VideoController WMI class represents the capabilities and management capacity of the video controller on a computer system running Windows. Starting with Windows Vista, properties of this class replace Win32_DisplayConfiguration. Starting with Windows Vista, hardware that is not compatible with Windows Display Driver Model (WDDM) returns inaccurate property values for instances of this class. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This class is supported.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.AdapterCompatibility
member.summary: General chipset used for this controller to compare compatibilities with the system.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.AdapterDACType
member.summary: Name or identifier of the digital-to-analog converter (DAC) chip. The character set of this property is alphanumeric.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.AdapterRAM
member.summary: Memory size of the video adapter.(Bytes) Example: 64000

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.ColorTableEntries
member.summary: Size of the system's color table. The device must have a color depth of no more than 8 bits per pixel; otherwise, this property is not set. Example: 256

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.DeviceSpecificPens
member.summary: Current number of device-specific pens. A value of 0xffff means that the device does not support pens. Example: 3

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.DitherType
member.summary: Dither type of the video controller. The property can be one of the predefined values, or a driver-defined value greater than or equal to 256. If line art dithering is chosen, the controller uses a dithering method that produces well-defined borders between black, white, and gray scalings. Line art dithering is not suitable for images that include continuous graduations in intensity and hue such as scanned photographs.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.DriverDate
member.summary: Last modification date and time of the currently installed video driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.DriverVersion
member.summary: Version number of the video driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.ICMIntent
member.summary: Specific value of one of the three possible color-matching methods or intents that should be used by default. This property is used primarily for non-ICM applications. ICM applications establish intents by using the ICM functions. This property can be a predefined value or a driver defined value greater than or equal to 256. Color matching based on saturation is the most appropriate choice for business graphs when dithering is not desired. Color matching based on contrast is the most appropriate choice for scanned or photographic images when dithering is desired. Color matching optimized to match the exact color requested is most appropriate for use with business logos or other images when an exact color match is desired.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.ICMMethod
member.summary: Method of handling ICM. For non-ICM applications, this property determines if ICM is enabled. For ICM applications, the system examines this property to determine how to handle ICM support. This property can be a predefined value or a driver-defined value greater than or equal to 256. The value determines which system handles image color matching.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.InfFilename
member.summary: Path to the video adapter's .inf file. Example: "C:\WINNT\SYSTEM32\DRIVERS"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.InfSection
member.summary: Section of the .inf file where the Windows video information resides.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.InstalledDisplayDrivers
member.summary: Name of the installed display device driver.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.Monochrome
member.summary: If TRUE, gray scale is used to display images.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.ReservedSystemPaletteEntries
member.summary: Number of reserved entries in the system palette. The operating system may reserve entries to support standard colors for task bars and other desktop display items. This index is valid only if the device driver sets the RC_PALETTE bit in the RASTERCAPS index, and is available only if the driver is compatible with 16-bit Windows. If the system is not using a palette, ReservedSystemPaletteEntries is not set. Example: 20

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.SpecificationVersion
member.summary: Version number of the initialization data specification (upon which the structure is based).

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.SystemPaletteEntries
member.summary: Current number of color index entries in the system palette. This index is valid only if the device driver sets the RC_PALETTE bit in the RASTERCAPS index, and is available only if the driver is compatible with 16-bit Windows. If the system is not using a palette, SystemPaletteEntries is not set. Example: 20

member.name: P:WMI.NET.ComputerSystemHardware.VideoAndMonitor.Win32_VideoController.VideoModeDescription
member.summary: Current resolution, color, and scan mode settings of the video controller. Example: "1024 x 768 x 256 colors"

member.name: T:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Account
member.summary: The Win32_Account abstract WMI class contains information about user accounts and group accounts known to the computer system running Windows. User or group names recognized by a Windows domain are descendants (or members) of this class.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Account.Domain
member.summary: Name of the Windows domain to which a group or user belongs. Example: "NA-SALES"

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Account.LocalAccount
member.summary: If TRUE, the account is defined on the local machine. To retrieve only accounts defined on the local machine, design a query that includes the condition "LocalAccount=TRUE".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Account.SID
member.summary: Security identifier (SID) for this account. A SID is a string value of variable length used to identify a trustee. Each account has a unique SID issued by an authority (such as a Windows domain), stored in a security database. When a user logs on, the system retrieves the user's SID from the database and places it in the user's access token. The system uses the SID in the user's access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security. When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot be used again to identify another user or group.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Account.SIDType
member.summary: Enumerated values that specify the type of security identifier (SID).

member.name: T:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Group
member.summary: The Win32_Group WMI class represents data about a group account. A group account allows access privileges to be changed for a list of users. Example: Marketing2.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_Group.Rename(System.String)
member.summary: The Rename WMI class method allows the group name to be changed.
member.param: Name of the Windows user account on the domain specified by the Domain property of this class.

member.name: T:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount
member.summary: The Win32_UserAccount WMI class contains information about a user account on a computer system running Windows. Note Because both the Name and Domain are key properties, enumerating Win32_UserAccount on a large network can negatively affect performance. Calling GetObject or querying for a specific instance has less impact.

member.name: M:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.Rename(System.String)
member.summary: The RenameWMI class method renames a user account name. This functionality is implemented as a method to provide a separate context for the new name that is distinguishable from the key property value for Name that is associated with the instance to be modified.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Flags that describe the characteristics of a Windows user account.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.Disabled
member.summary: Windows user account is disabled.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.FullName
member.summary: Full name of a local user, for example: "Dan Wilson".

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.Lockout
member.summary: If true, the user account is locked out of the Windows operating system.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.PasswordChangeable
member.summary: If true, the password on this user account can be changed.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.PasswordExpires
member.summary: If true, the password on this user account expires.

member.name: P:WMI.NET.OperatingSystem.Users.Win32_UserAccount.PasswordRequired
member.summary: If true, a password is required on a Windows user account. If false, this account does not require a password.
